justification: "The curvature of the response trajectory is used to assess the degree of its attraction towards the non-chosen option … we focus on a frequently used index known as the (signed) maximum absolute deviation (MAD)."
Table 1 lists "Area under curve (AUC) – geometric area between observed trajectory and direct path" among the curvature indices proposed to quantify the same attraction-related construct.
"The most common measure of complexity is x-flips, the number of directional changes along the x-axis."
"Other mouse-tracking studies have used sample entropy which quantifies the degree of unpredictability of movement along the x-axis."
"Koop and Johnson (2013) propose… x-reversals (i.e., the number of times the cursor crosses the vertical axis at the midpoint between the two options) indicate changes of absolute preference."
"The analysis of velocity … has been used to investigate response activation and competition."
The same sentence notes that analyses of "velocity and acceleration" are employed to study response activation and competition.

topic_or_construct: direction of movement toward or away from an option
justification: "An emerging class of analyses has focused on the movement angle, which quantifies the direction of movement over time indicating, for example, whether participants move towards or away from a specific response alternative."
